text: Bessie Lillian Gordy Carter (August 15, 1898 - October 30, 1983) was an American nurse, political activist and humanitarian. She was born in Richland, Georgia. Carter was the mother of former President of the United States, Jimmy Carter. She was also known for her works to nursing in her home state of Georgia and as a Peace Corps volunteer in India as well as writing two books during the Carter presidency.peacecorps.gov Carter died in Americus, Georgia on October 30, 1983 from bone, pancreatic and breast cancer at the age of 85. ==References== Category:1898 births Category:1983 deaths Category:Deaths from pancreatic cancer Category:Deaths from bone cancer Category:Deaths from breast cancer Category:Cancer deaths in Georgia (U.S. state) Category:American political activists Category:American political writers Category:Humanitarians Category:People from Plains, Georgia Category:Writers from Georgia (U.S. state) Category:Democrats (United States)
